title: Advancing Global Climate Action: A Conversation with MEP Mohammed Chahim
description: You are cordially invited to attend a livestream conversation with Mohammed Chahim, Member of European Parliament from the Netherlands and rapporteur on the carbon border adjustment mechanism currently proposed in the European Union.

title: How U.S. LNG Could Help Europe and Climate
description: Europe and the United States can help expand U.S. LNG supply in a way that enhances near-term European energy security but also helps displace coal in Asia in the long term. It’s a win-win—for the United States, for Europe, for Asia, and for the climate.

title: Beyond 2025: The Future of the African Growth and Opportunity Act
description: CSIS releases a new report that examines what comes next in the U.S.-Africa commercial and economic partnerships after the AGOA legislation expires in 2025.

title: Early Lessons for the United States from Russia’s Second Ukraine Invasion
description: The conflict in Ukraine has upended assumptions about the international order. Ukraine’s resistance to Russia’s invasion also offers lessons for other parts of the world to better prepare for future authoritarian disruptions, especially for the United States in Asia.

title: The Evening: Temporary Local Cease-Fires, Putin Vows Victory, Heartbreaker Mike Campbell, and More
description: This edition of CSIS's nightly newsletter covers the Temporary Local Cease-Fires, Putin Vows Victory, Heartbreaker Mike Campbell, and More.

title: The Final Approach? A Fireside Chat with Scott Kirby, CEO of United Airlines
description: Please join the CSIS Commission on Strengthening America’s Health Security on Wednesday, March 2, from 3:00 p.m. to 4:00 p.m. ET, for a fireside chat with Scott Kirby, CEO of United Airlines.

title: China’s Economy and Ukraine: All Downside Risks
description: The potential short-term risks for China’s economy emanating from the Ukraine crisis are all manageable, but the longer the time horizon, the greater are the dangers to China’s economy and its international influence.

title: Going Green While Building Peace: Technology, Climate, and Peacebuilding
description: There is a complex, cyclical, and mutually destructive relationship between climate change and violent conflict. Emerging technologies should be analyzed and deployed in a conflict-sensitive way to help break the cycle.

title: The Latest on Southeast Asia: March 3, 2022
description: Southeast Asian governments are not of one mind when it comes to the appropriate response to Russia’s invasion of Ukraine. But they are mostly agreed on the facts and share similar concerns.

title: Russian Invasion of Ukraine Should Force a Rethink about Russian Presence in the Americas
description: Given the global revulsion surrounding Russia’s unprovoked invasion of Russia, governments in Latin America and the Caribbean should rethink their relationship with Vladimir Putin’s Russia.

title: U.S. Military Forces in FY 2022: Peering into the Abyss
description: This report is a compilation of the "U.S. Military Forces in FY 2022" white paper series, covering in detail the overall strategy and priorities of the DOD by service as well as SOF, contractors, and DOD civilians.

title: Solidifying Partnership Gains through Enhanced Defense Industrial Cooperation
description: Russia’s invasion of Ukraine underscores the critical need for defense industrial and technological cooperation, not only to combat coercive spheres of influence but also to bolster capabilities and the potential for action.
